subject: Action required: Cookie Consent Requirements for Movement Rehabilitation – updated timeline & action
preview: [image: microsoft] <https://www.microsoft.com>  Hi Andy Crebar,  Microsoft Clarity will begin enforcing cookie consent requirements in the European Economic Area (EEA), UK, and Switzerland. To a

action.text: Workflow **Notifications moved to Alerts Inbox** was triggered

full_threads.body:
[image: microsoft] <https://www.microsoft.com>

Hi Andy Crebar,

Microsoft Clarity will begin enforcing cookie consent requirements in the
European Economic Area (EEA), UK, and Switzerland. To avoid impact to data
collection and Clarity features' functionalities, you must send an explicit
consent signal to Clarity using one of the supported methods. We are
rolling out enforcement in phases, with full enforcement taking effect
on *October
31st, 2025*.

We have received numerous questions regarding the upcoming changes to
cookie consent requirements, and we would like to help clarify what this
means for you.
What Does This Mean for Movement Rehabilitation
<https://clarity.microsoft.com/projects/view/sy1ic8s052/dashboard?utm_source=email&utm_medium=updates&utm_campaign=cookie_consent_action_required_update>?
Action Required: Starting *October 31st*, you are required to share user
consent signals for sessions originating from the EEA, UK, and Switzerland.
If consent is not obtained and signaled using one of the supported
methods, certain
Clarity features will be impacted
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/clarity-without-cookie-consent>.
Please ensure consent signals are implemented before this date to avoid
disruptions to Movement Rehabilitation
<https://clarity.microsoft.com/projects/view/sy1ic8s052/dashboard?utm_source=email&utm_medium=updates&utm_campaign=cookie_consent_action_required_update>
functionality for users in these regions.

- You can share consent via Google Consent Mode
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/cookie-gcm>,
supported Consent Management Platforms (CMPs)
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/cookie-cmps>,
or Clarity Consent API
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/clarity-consent-api-v2>.

- Most CMPs support Google Consent Mode. If you prefer a native
CMP-Clarity integration, you can use CookieYes
<https://www.cookieyes.com/documentation/microsoft-clarity-consent-api/>.

- For customers who use content management systems to host their sites
and integrate Clarity, review the recommended plugins: Third-Party
Integrations
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/third-party-integrations/cookie-integrations>.


For more details, refer to our Clarity Consent documentation
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/consent-management>.


Rollout Status: This requirement will be enforced across the European
region by *October 31st, 2025*.
FAQs

- *What happens if consent is not provided?*
Without explicit consent, features such as session recordings and funnel
tracking may be impacted
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/clarity-without-cookie-consent>.
Data collected during these sessions will not be associated to a visitor
without a valid cookie.
- *If I don't obtain cookie consent, what impact does it have on my end
users?*
End users will not experience any impact to their interaction with the
website. However, your experience with the Clarity site will be impacted,
as the functionality of specific Clarity features will be limited
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/clarity-without-cookie-consent>.

- *How do I implement the consent API?*
Please refer to the Clarity Consent API documentation
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/clarity-consent-api-v2>
for detailed guidance on how to call the API.
- *Will my existing Clarity setup need changes?*
Yes, if you're not currently sending consent signals. You may need to:
- Integrate the Clarity Consent API
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/clarity-consent-api-v2>
or
- Configure your Consent Management Platform (CMP)
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/cookie-cmps>
to send valid consent or update Third-party Integrations
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/third-party-integrations/cookie-integrations>
to ensure consent is passed before Clarity activates
- *How can a site owner verify that they implemented the cookie consent
correctly on their website?*
Refer to the Consent Mode documentation to verify that cookie consent
has been implemented correctly. For more details, refer to our Consent
documentation
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/setup-and-installation/consent-management>
and Consent FAQs
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/faq#as-a-site-owner--how-can-i-verify-that-i-ve-implemented-cookie-consent-correctly-on-my-website->.

- *How do I implement consent for mobile app projects?*
No action is currently required for mobile app projects in Clarity.

If you have any questions or need assistance, please don’t hesitate to
contact our support team at clarityms@microsoft.com.
Thank you,
The Microsoft Clarity Team
Privacy Statement <https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521839>

Microsoft Corporation
One Microsoft Way, Redmond, WA 98052
